Name: Amber Primordial Direhorn
Notes_2: Amber, Jade and Slate Primordial Direhorns are dropped by rare Zandalari Warbringers in Pandaria. Each drops a mount of the same colour as the one he rides. They spawn across five different zones and the colour spawned each time is random.
Requirements:
This mount is available to all eligible characters on your account.
Level 40
Journeyman (150) Riding
Source:
Zandalari Warbringer.
The Black Market Auction House (rarely)

This mount is available to all eligible characters on your account.

Cost: 10 000 (reputation discounts apply for some factions)

Name: Ashhide Mushan Beast
Notes_2:
The Bloody Coins required to purchase this mount may be obtained by engaging in a special type of PvP:
You are awarded a coin if you get the killing blow on a PvP opponent while you are transformed into an Ordon Fire-Watcher.
To transform into an Ordon Fire-Watcher you need to purchase the item, Fire-Watcher's Oath, sold by Speaker Gulan on the Timeless Isle for 100 Timeless Coins. Timeless Coins are earned easily by killing NPCs/opening chests/performing various quests on the Timeless Isle.
The Fire-Watcher's Oath buff should work anywhere where PvP is allowed (including battlegrounds).
The Censer of Eternal Agony (toy) can be used instead, but it has many downsides: its usage is restricted to the Timeless Isle, it has much longer cooldowns, and it debuffs the victim so that they won't grant more than one coin within a 10-minute period. On the other hand it allows you to kill members of your own faction who are similarly flagged, which the Fire-Watcher's Oath doesn't.
Requirements:
This mount is available to all eligible characters on your account.
Level 85
Journeyman (150) Riding
Source:
Speaker Gulan in Timeless Isle.
Cost: 500

Name: Black Primal Raptor
Notes_2: A Primal Egg is a rare drop from devilsaurs, direhorns and skyscreamers on Isle of Giants. After three days it will become a Cracked Primal Egg, with 100% chance of looting the Reins of the Black, Green or Red Primal Raptor. The mount is random and it's possible to receive the same mount twice.
Requirements:
This mount is available to all eligible characters on your account.
Level 40
Journeyman (150) Riding
Source: Primal Egg in Various dinosaurs, Isle of Giants.

Name: Dread Raven
Notes_2:
This mount is one of the rewards for purchasing the Warlords of Draenor Collector's Edition or the Digital Deluxe Edition. It has clear similarities to Anzu, the non-flying Raven Lord mount from the Burning Crusade. It's even possible it's meant to be a version of Anzu from before he was corrupted.
If a Dread Hatchling companion is out while you mount up, it will send love to its presumed parent!
Requirements:
This mount is available to all eligible characters on your account.
Level 20
Apprentice (75) Riding
Source: Promotion: Collector's Edition

Name: Jade Panther
Notes_2:
This flying jade feline is manufactured by a Jewelcrafter, but it doesn't require any Jewelcrafting skill to use, and the object that teaches it can be traded or purchased on the Auction House.

If you wish to craft your own, however, you need a Pandaria Jewelcrafting skill of at least 75 and Honored reputation with Order of the Cloud Serpent to learn the recipe.
Requirements:
This mount is available to all eligible characters on your account.
Level 40
Journeyman (150) Riding
Source:
Profession : Jewelcrafting
Recipe sold by San Redscale in The Arboretum, The Jade Forest.

This flying sunstone feline is manufactured by a Jewelcrafter, but it doesn't require any Jewelcrafting skill to use, and the object that teaches it can be traded or purchased on the Auction House.

If you wish to craft your own, however, you need a Pandaria Jewelcrafting skill of at least 75 and Honored reputation with Order of the Cloud Serpent to learn the recipe.
Requirements:
This mount is available to all eligible characters on your account.
Level 40
Journeyman (150) Riding
Source:
Profession : Jewelcrafting
Recipe sold by San Redscale in The Arboretum, The Jade Forest.

Name: Thundering Ruby Cloud Serpent
Notes_2:
This mount is a guaranteed drop from Alani <The Stormborn>, who roams the skies of the Vale of Eternal Blossoms. However killing her is not as simple as it may seem; to attack her you must first have collected and fused ten Sky Crystals, which are extremely rare loot from the denizens of the Vale.
Of note, if someone is in group with you when you defeat her they may also be able to loot the mount, so be careful!
Requirements:
This mount is available to all eligible characters on your account.
Level 90
Cloud Serpent Riding Riding
Source:
Alani <The Stormborn> in Vale of Eternal Blossoms.
The Black Market Auction House (rarely)

Name: Vicious Kaldorei Warsaber
Notes_2:
To purchase this armoured warsaber you must be victorious in a great many rated arenas or battlegrounds in a single PvP season. The procedure is as follows:
You must reach the PvP rank of Combatant. You can obtain this ranking by reaching a rating of 1400 by competing in 2v2, 3v3, or 10v10 arenas and battlegrounds.
Once you've reached Combatant ranking you must win further matches in the same season, until your progress bar reaches 100% (2400 points). You'll then receive the current season's mount (not this one).
For each subsequent time you fill your progress bar during the season you'll receive a Vicious Saddle, which you may use to purchase older Vicious mounts, including this one.
It appears the 1400 rating is specific to the match type you earned it in. For example, if you only earned the rating in 10v10 then you cannot progress towards the mount in 2v2 (until you also earn a 1400 rating in the latter).
The number of matches required to fill your progress bar depends on the type of match. According to comments on Wowhead, by Rainewater, you require 40 wins from 10v10 (60 points / win), 80 wins from 3v3 (30 points / win), or 240 wins from 2v2 (10 points / win).
Requirements:
This mount is available to all eligible characters on your account.
Level 40
Journeyman (150) Riding
Alliance Only
Source:
Necrolord Sipe in Stormwind City.
Cost: 1

Name: Vicious Skeletal Warhorse
Notes_2:
To purchase this armoured skeletal steed you must be victorious in a great many rated arenas or battlegrounds in a single PvP season. The procedure is as follows:
You must reach the PvP rank of Combatant. You can obtain this ranking by reaching a rating of 1400 by competing in 2v2, 3v3, or 10v10 arenas and battlegrounds.
Once you've reached Combatant ranking you must win further matches in the same season, until your progress bar reaches 100% (2400 points). You'll then receive the current season's mount (not this one).
For each subsequent time you fill your progress bar during the season you'll receive a Vicious Saddle, which you may use to purchase older Vicious mounts, including this one.
It appears the 1400 rating is specific to the match type you earned it in. For example, if you only earned the rating in 10v10 then you cannot progress towards the mount in 2v2 (until you also earn a 1400 rating in the latter).
The number of matches required to fill your progress bar depends on the type of match. According to comments on Wowhead, by Rainewater, you require 40 wins from 10v10 (60 points / win), 80 wins from 3v3 (30 points / win), or 240 wins from 2v2 (10 points / win).
Requirements:
This mount is available to all eligible characters on your account.
Level 40
Journeyman (150) Riding
Horde Only
Source:
Deathguard Netharian in Orgrimmar.
Cost: 1

Name: Warforged Nightmare
Notes_2:
Available from the Blizzard store, this flying, fiery steed comes with extra goodies: The purchaser also receives a Nightmarish Hitching Post which allows their friends to summon temporary versions of the same mount. As a result it's a little more expensive than most Store mounts.
See also the Ironbound Wraithcharger for a similarly-themed mount in blue.
Requirements:
This mount is available to all eligible characters on your account.
Level 20
Apprentice (75) Riding
Source:
Blizzard Shop (US/EU)
Cost: US$30 / €30 (subject to change)
